Title: Consultant in Power Amplifier Design
RoleDescription:
About the Role: We are seeking a skilled engineer for a client-specific assignment, focusing on the design and verification of high-power amplifiers (60-100W per branch). This role involves ensuring that amplifiers meet the required output power while maintaining optimal performance, efficiency, and thermal management. You will conduct rigorous testing to verify amplifier performance under various operational conditions, ensuring optimal signal integrity and power efficiency. Your work will include debugging amplifiers when parameters do not meet specifications, ensuring the reliability and robustness of transistors and power amplifiers. Additionally, you will apply thermal management concepts to transistors and components, understand linearization techniques, and collaborate with PAX mechanics. Comprehensive radio performance testing will also be part of your responsibilities to ensure product quality.Ideal candidates will have:Basic RF knowledgeExperience in RF radio labs and with relevant instrumentsExperience in uplink and downlink RF analogue systemizationsUnderstanding of PA basic architectures (Classes AB, B, F, Doherty, etc.)Familiarity with PA parameters: Psat, Gain, AMPM, Eff, ACLR, OBUE, CW/modulated/xTone measurements, baseband-linearity conceptsAbility to debug a PA when parameters are not meeting specsReliability/Robustness of transistors/PAsThermal concepts for transistors/PAs (and components)Understanding of linearization conceptsKnowledge of GaN and its challenges: trapping, drifts, variabilitiesKnowledge of PAX mechanics (coins, preforms, building practice, etc.)Basic physics concepts of transistorsAbility to measure the parameters mentioned aboveUnderstanding of link/power budgetsMeasurement and instrument knowledgePerforming comprehensive radio performance tests to ensure product quality   Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Title: Optics & photonics engineer
RoleDescription:
AFRY's optics group is expanding, and we need more consultants for our assignments!We are looking for a specialist in optics and photonics. As a consultant in this area, you will work on both in-house assignments and assignments at our customers' locations. Within the optics group, fostering a good team spirit is crucial. Regardless of the assignment, we maintain regular contact with group members. It should be easy to ask questions, and you should always feel that you have colleagues to discuss things with, whether within or outside your specialist area. You will encounter development opportunities in various areas involving applications of optical systems. These include advanced laser systems for material processing and lithography, LIDAR, and various types of optical sensors. You will work on classic lens design and design of lens systems such as objectives, collimators, and projectors. Additionally, you will be involved in the design and construction of measurement and verification systems with optics, optimization of lighting systems, and light-guiding for electronic devices or for aesthetic and practical purposes. We also offer our clients optics-related courses and tailor-made education, or we can act as advisors in optics. We are looking for somebody with preferably a PhD degree in optics or photonics. In addition, you have experience of building and working with optical measurement setups, ideally in a clean-room environment. You will have a lot of contact with colleagues and customers, which means that you need to have good knowledge of English, both in speech and in writing. We think you may have some of the following personal characteristics: An initiative taker  A creative mindset and a willing to learn new things A problem solving and analytical attitude A team-player with a skill for communicating results We are looking for someone who possesses expertise in several key areas. Ideal candidates will have experience in optical design and be proficient with Zemax or similar simulation software. A solid understanding of wave optics is essential, along with skills in concept development and optical engineering. Creativity in concept development and a strong knowledge of optical and electro-optical components are also highly valued. Additionally, experience from R&D and/or product development is important. Meritorious Experience: Sensor technologies Material physics Lens design Development of test equipment (innovative and creative) Analysis instruments in life science Waveguide and meta surface design Optical communication Fiber optics  Location: Stockholm, Sweden
